description.narrative: By 2020, the social protection system is further integrated and strengthened to effectively identify and respond to vulnerabilities of children to poverty and deprivation.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Public Finance for Children)
UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Social Protection and Child Poverty)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Armenia: Final Evaluation of Mitigating Social Consequences of the Labour Migration and Maximising the Migrants’ Involvement in Local Development Project
Armenia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the social protection system is further integrated and strengthened to effectively identify and respond to vulnerabilities of children to poverty and deprivation.

description.narrative: A holistic review of the functional effectiveness, system and programmes in social protection resulted in concrete strategic and policy changes to address effects of poverty and deprivation on children, through joint advocacy and multiple partnerships. Resources were leveraged for social sectors to achieve better outcomes for children. Shock-responsiveness of the social protection system was advanced. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2020

title.narrative: 2.5 Public spending on social protection from domestic resources as a proportion of national budget
1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures
Public spending on health, education and social protection
Proportion of children covered by social assistance programmes

target.value: 2020:Disaggregation is available, including other parameters if necessary

title.narrative: Existence of an integrated social services system countrywide

baseline.value: Weak ISS system in place, with weaknesses in terms of coverage, integration, coordination, child-sensitivity, M&E and financing framework

target.value: 2020:Moderate ISS system in place, with moderate coverage, integration, coordination, child sensitivity, M&E and financing framework

actual.value: 2019:Weak ISS system in place, with improvements in terms of coverage, integration, coordination, child-sensitivity, M&E and financing framework
